intro: Dialium fleuryi, commonly known as the African starfruit tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright orange, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its fruit. The tree is also valued for its timber and traditional medicinal uses.
